scenario_text.value:
The last time I saw them was somewhere around
here.
(If he’s right, there could be a clue.)
What a good memory!
Are you sure?
We’ve seen this place.
You remembered! Way to go, Professor!

Actually, the area around the Kemonogami
shrine is very important to my research.

I’ve never heard of them anywhere else.
Are they a local legend?

Yes. I’ve examined the area around this
shrine countless times doing fieldwork.
I do think this is it, but...
I don’t recognize this terrain at all.
At...all?
It’s like we’re in a parallel world.
I think we’ve seen this place before, though.
Yes! When we first came to the shrine!

The shrine is the same, but it’s like the
same building was built on different land.

Well, perhaps not the “same”... It’s like a
fake made with similar construction.

I knew it.
We’re in another world after all...

Who knows? At first I thought I might be
hallucinating...

Look, human footprints! These are smaller
than Aoi’s.

These others are bigger than Takuma’s.
They head that way!

Your intuition was right all along. I knew
you could do it, Professor!

Even if I’m not familiar with an area, working
in the field has taught me to retrace my steps.

This proves that there are no problems in my
sense of direction or awareness.

Look, look! There’s some HUGE footprints over
here!

It looks like...they’re chasing after this
pair of human prints!
That’s not good. Friend or foe?

It is difficult to tell from footprints
alone...

It’s hard to explain, but I can get a read on
them from their aura or their scent...

Some are clever, though, covering up or
disguising any trace of themselves.
Boy, I guess it takes all kinds, huh?

We know something bad is after those two,
either way. We’d better hurry...

Indeed. Perhaps we should not just look, but
listen for clues as well.
Hmm... Yeah, something’s close.
You’re scaring me...

Oh yeah, Professor, you mentioned something
before we came to this world...

About ritual human sacrifice, right?
A nasty story...

Still, you’d think they’d get something from
the Kemonogami in exchange, right?

Ethics change with the times. We can’t just
criticize the ways of the past...

But as a modern individual, the idea of
forcing children into sacrifice is appalling.
Yeah, I couldn’t agree more!
Who the hell cares about that?
Human sacrifice. Could it be...?
Hmm? You say something?
Nothing. Forget about it.

At any rate, we should follow those nasty-
looking prints if we want to find the others.

...Let’s go, everyone.
And stay sharp!
You sonuva—
Huh? Did you hear that voice just now?
Hey! The bad ones again?!

That was deep in the forest! It might be Saki
and Shuuji. Let’s go!
